intro: Saxifraga hypnoides subsp. borealiatlantica, commonly known as the northern saxifrage, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the Arctic and subarctic regions of North America and Eurasia. It typically forms dense mats of fleshy, dark green leaves that are often covered in a whitish coating, known as a farina. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink, typically blooming in late summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in tundra and alpine habitats. Saxifraga hypnoides subsp. borealiatlantica is adapted to cold climates and can survive harsh winter conditions.
